conclusion: Identify the problem as finding work done by an ideal gas in a cyclic process.
The p-V diagram has volume on x-axis and pressure on y-axis with points A, B, and C.
Point A is at (2 L, 1 × 10^5 Pa), Point B is at (2 L, 4 × 10^5 Pa), Point C is at (5 L, 1 × 10^5 Pa).
Process A to B is a vertical line indicating constant volume.
Process B to C is a straight line indicating decreasing pressure and increasing volume.
Process C to A is a horizontal line indicating constant pressure.
Calculate work done by summing work in each process.
Work done by gas is given by W = ∫P dV.
For process A to B, W_AB = 0 because it's a constant volume process.
For process B to C, express pressure as P = mV + b.
Calculate slope m = -1 × 10^5 Pa/L for line B to C.
Calculate y-intercept b = 6 × 10^5 Pa using point B.
Pressure function for B to C is P(V) = (-1 × 10^5 Pa/L) V + 6 × 10^5 Pa.
Calculate work W_BC = ∫(2 to 5) (-1 × 10^5 V + 6 × 10^5) dV.
Integrate to find W_BC = [-0.5 × 10^5 V^2 + 6 × 10^5 V] from 2 L to 5 L.
